DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy T2 Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Abnormality Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the administration of radiation therapy to a T2/FLAIR (Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery) abnormality.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy T2 Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Abnormality Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the administration of radiation therapy to a T2/FLAIR (Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery) abnormality.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Time Integer::2 Fluid Attenuated Inversion Recovery Abnormality Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.:A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
